comments.body:
I think the two paragraphs below should also be amended.

It is not important the reader learns about the history of ansible-vault and Ansible. This documentation should be written for someone coming to it fresh, using the current version of Ansible.

I think these paragraphs should be replace by a short note at the end of the section, something like:

```
.. note:
    Older versions of Ansible, before 2.4, only supported using one single vault password at a time. 
```

Hello,

Unless I've mis-githubbed it should be done.

Vault-encrypted content can specify which vault ID it was encrypted with.

For example, a playbook can now include a vars file encrypted with a 'dev' vault
ID and a 'prod' vault ID.
